pullRequest.title: Provide Thrift Plugin
pullRequest.bodyText:
Please answer these questions before submitting a pull request


Why submit this pull request?


 Bug fix


 New feature provided


 Improve performance


Related issues
closes #1534



New feature or improvement
Provide Thrift Plugin
Because Thrift cannot carry metadata to transport Trace Header in the original API, we transport those by wrapping TProtocolFactory to do that.
Principle about transport Trace Header
Thrift allows us to append any additional field in the Message even if the receiver doesn't deal with them. This data is going to be skipped while no one reads. Base on this, we take the 8888th field of Message to store Trace Header(or metadata) and to transport. That means the message with 8888 field id must be revered.
Anyway, I don't think have any message big in reality.
Snapshot

nodes.bodyText: Finally:  If you return or throw from a finally, then values returned or thrown from the try-catch block will be ignored. Consider using try-with-resources instead.
Finally:  If you return or throw from a finally, then values returned or thrown from the try-catch block will be ignored. Consider using try-with-resources instead.
JdkObsolete:  StringBuffer performs synchronization that is usually unnecessary; prefer StringBuilder.
MissingOverride:  getArguments implements method in AbstractContext; expected @OverRide

nodes.bodyText: MissingOverride:  getOperatorName implements method in AbstractContext; expected @OverRide
Should provide the full class name here. Also, I don't think only a @see is a reasonable comment.
See should be after the real comments, not before.

commit.message: Merge branch 'plugin/thrift-1' of https://github.com/dmsolr/skywalking into plugin/thrift-1

nodes.bodyText:
This is not the only constructor signature of the two classes in line 39/40.
For example, private TNonblockingSocket(SocketChannel socketChannel, int timeout, SocketAddress socketAddress) {, please recheck
Should be super.readMapEnd();?
I think this should be in the finally block, otherwise, if it throws exception, there may be an infinite recursive call of readFieldBegin.
initialed -> initialized

commit.message: Merge branch 'plugin/thrift-1' of https://github.com/dmsolr/skywalking into plugin/thrift-1

nodes.bodyText: log#throwable has included errorOccurred already
This check is unusual, could you explain why?
Same question for all ContextManager.isActive() check.
All catches are not necessary in the interceptor scope, as the core has try/catch-log already.
Same question, why need this?

nodes.bodyText: I guess transparent should be transform or wrap, transparent is an adjective, same as the other places where transparent appeared
